Articles.Content:
CHALLENGE: collide two asteroids together at extremely high velocities danny2462 style!

specifics

A: relative velocity at moment of impact is greater than 1500 m/s as measured by the "target" velocity on the navball 

B: At least one asteroid must have an escape trajectory from its relative body

Hardmode: both asteroids must be E class and collision velocity is greater than 2000 m/s

danny2462's video (actual idea came from around 1:30) :

 

Edited May 14, 2016 by Kepler68
Added YouTube link

Considering how frustrating it is to simply redirect asteroids in the first place, impacting two is not something most kerbaunauts would define as "fun". I don't think you will have much contender.

Can we see your attempt at it?
didn't realize it would be tedious, ill try it tomorrow
Impossible without slow motion time warp since they will phase through each other.
